Sentence.sentence: Participation grows through friends and networks and if you realize that's how they're growing, you can start to take action and bring in other students, he said.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At this time there is nothing to take action on since the analysis has yet to be completed.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Action to restore appropriate price incentives, notably through corrective carbon pricing, is urgently needed to lower the risk of irreversible and potentially devastating effects of climate change.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To show the urgent need for the government to take action.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But now, as then, powerful forces are ideologically opposed to the whole idea of government action on a sufficient scale to jump-start the economy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As I said, structural unemployment isn't a real problem, it's an excuse—a reason not to act on America's problems at a time when action is desperately needed.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The Paris climate agreement finalised in December last year heralded a new era for climate action.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Prime Minister Cameron has been reluctant to take action.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Take your average trade union member, chances are they will be politically motivated and be used to collective action— much like Erica Gregory.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One study shows that our neighbours' actions are influential in changing our behaviour.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Nick Perks, project director for Climate Solidarity, believes this sort of activity is where the future of environmental action lies.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But it was the ones that mentioned the actions of neighbours that drove down power use.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A retired member of the Public and Commercial Services Union, she is setting up one of 1,100 action groups with the support of Climate Solidarity, a two-year environmental campaign aimed at trade unionists.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Some performance evaluations require supervisors to take action.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This situation is more serious, and the supervisor may need to take action
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The action should beconsistent with the firm's guidelines and may include reassigning the employees to new jobs, suspending them temporarily, or firing them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A supervisor's action toward a poorly performing worker can affect the attitudes of other employees
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The recent trend toward early decision and early action among selective colleges and universities has pushed the traditional deadline of January up to Nov.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: When supervisors give employees an unfavorable evaluation, they must decide whether to take any additional actions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Government action is key to solving economic problems.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In 2005, the Authors Guild of America, together with a group of US publishers, launched a class action suit (集团诉讼) against Google that, after more than two years of negotiation, ended with an announcement last October that Google and the claimants had reached an out-of-court settlement.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What do we learn about the class action suit against Google
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What remained controversial after the class action suit ended?
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Some critics blame affirmative action – students admitted with lower test scores and grades from shaky high schools often struggle at elite schools.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Affirmative action should be held responsible
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Whether all that attention has translated into sufficient action is another question.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I imagine that what my parents were trying to teach me was to take responsibilities for my actions and my choices.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: All right, Jane,let's put it into action.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: And for this to happen, we may need action on a global scale.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: But the status quo can be problematic, since a change in the course of action can sometimes be important and lead to a positive outcome.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: nick Perks, project director for Climate Solidarity, believes this sort of activity is where the future of environmental action lies.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Participation grows through friends and networks and if "you realize that's how they're growing, you can start to take action" and bring in other students, he said.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Rosen says he hopes Congress will take action.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Take your average trade union member, chances are they will be politically motivated and be used to collective action —much like Erica Gregory.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: That's not to say that risk is always good, but it is related to taking action, whereas decision fatigue assuredly leads to inaction and the possible chagrin of a decision maker who might otherwise prefer a new course but is unfortunately hindered.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The action stems from a federal court order issued on Tuesday requiring Apple to help the Federal Bureau of Investigation to unlock an iPhone used by one of the two attackers who killed 14 people in San Bernardino, California, in December.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The Child Poverty Action Group says 9 out of 30 in every classroom fall below the poverty line.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The market for products designed specifically for older adults could reach $30 billion by next year, and startups want in on the action.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The team plans to return to around a dozen of the buildings to assess progress and consider further action.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The World Meteorological Organization points to Cuba and Bangladesh as examples of countries that have successfully reduced the loss of life caused by natural disasters by taking preventive action.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"行为，行动"之意。
means: act ：一般指具体的、短暂的或个别的行为，强调行为的完成及其效果。
action ：普通用词，着重行动的过程。
deed ：较庄重用词，除泛指各种行为外，还可用于指某种高尚或伟大的行为，故常译作"功绩，业绩"。
operation ：多指一连串行动或行为的完成方式。
performance ：主要指行动的方式方法。

stems_affixes.word_buile: act行动,活动,做+ing……的→adj.代理的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 积极的, 能起作用的, 现行的
stems_affixes.word_buile: act行动,活动,做+ive……的→积极的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实际的, 真实的, 现行的, 目前的
stems_affixes.word_buile: act做+ual=al……的→做了的→实际的, 真实的
exact[v.强求;精确的]+ing……的→adj.苛求的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 反应的, 起反作用的, 反动的, 电抗性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: react反应;反抗+ive……的→反应的,反动的
act行动,活动,做→v.行动,行为,扮演 n.[戏]幕

stems_affixes.value_cn: 动作, 作用, 战斗, 行动, 举动, 行为
stems_affixes.word_buile: act活动+ion动作或状态→动作,活动
act行动,活动,做+ivity特性→活动
in不+activity活跃→n.不活跃

stems_affixes.value_cn: 反应, 反作用, 反动[力]
stems_affixes.word_buile: react反应;反抗+ion动作或状态→n.反应, 反作用, 反动[力]
react反应+or物器→n.反应堆
act行动,活动,做→v.行动,行为,扮演 n.[戏]幕
act行动,活动,做+ivate使→使……活动
actual实际的+ize化→实际化→实现
counter反+act行动,活动,做→反着动→力量对抗→抵消
en使+act行动,活动,做→使[法律]动→实施法律
ex出+act行动,活动,做→[要求]做出来→强求
inter相互+act行动,活动,做→相互动→相互作用
re反+act行动,活动,做→反动;反应
trans横+act行动,活动,做→横向动→互相贸易或交易

word_mean: 动作：全身、局部或脏器显示的功能或运动
施加在结构上的一组力或引起结构变形的原因，前者称荷载

Sentence.sentence: All of this makes the actions of the homeless tom smith even more remarkable.

Sentence.sentence: But you can't be successful when there's a lack of trust in a relationship that results from an action where the wrongdoer takes no responsibility to fix the mistake.

Sentence.sentence: Corrado, a translator for the army during wwii, was killed in action in Europe.

Sentence.sentence: Elsewhere in asia even more astonishing actions are being taken.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: I was performing this action of waiting until it later became a habit.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: If you have somewhere you want to go, something you want to accomplish, someone you want to become...take immediate action.

Sentence.sentence: One can never be sure that it is not on the point of breaking out into action only sure that it will do so sometime.

Sentence.sentence: Positive thinking and action result in success.

Sentence.sentence: Since then, many scientists have thought that our actions do make a difference.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Somehow in this or that man's thought such an idea lives though unconsidered by the world of action.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Take no further action if they can find a kitemark.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: Taylor's swift action helped her teammates calm down.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: That action turned the block into somewhat a wheel.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: The end result is that we feel like we can't focus or that we're focused on the wrong things, and so we take less action, make less progress, and stay the same when we could be improving.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: These actions have greatly affected the ecological balance.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: To explain this phenomenon, the researchers explored the degree to which a good performance by a team requires its members to coordinate their actions.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: However， Allen believed that the unconscious mind generates as much action as the conscious mind， and  while we may be able to sustain the illusion of control through the conscious mind alone， in reality we are continually faced with a question： “Why cannot I make myself do this or achieve that？ ”Since desire and will are damaged by the presence of thoughts that do not accord with desire， Allen concluded ： “ We do not attract what we want， but what we are.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: Rosenberg, the recipient of a Pulitzer Prize, offers a host of example of the social cure in action: In South Carolina, a state-sponsored antismoking program called Rage Against the Haze sets out to make cigarettes uncool.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Prior knowledge and interest influence what we experience, what we think our experiences mean, and the subsequent actions we take.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In 2010, leading congressional Democrats and Republicans sent letters to the AAAS asking that it identify actions that could be taken by “federal, state and local governments, universities, foundations, educators, individual benefactors and others” to “maintain national excellence in humanities and social scientific scholarship and education”.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In contrast to France’s actions, Denmark’s fashion industry agreed last month on rules and sanctions regarding the age, health, and other characteristics of models.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A "town of culture" could be not just about the arts but about honoring a town's peculiarities-helping sustain its high street, supporting local facilities and above all celebrating its people and turn it into action.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Emerging in the late sixties and reaching a peak in the Seventies, Land Art was one of a range of new forms, including Body Art,Performance Art, Action Art and Installation Art, which pushed art beyond the traditional confines of the studio and gallery.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In particular, they called for forging closer collaborations with western state governments, which are often uneasy with federal action, and with the private landowners who control an estimated 95% of the prairie chicken's habitat.
Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Last year, Europe Commission vice President Viviane Reding issued a call to voluntary action.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Quotas get action: they "open the way to equality and they break through the glass ceiling, " according to Reding, a result seen in France and other countries with legally binding provisions on placing women in top business positions.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: They argue that government action is necessary to curb Britain's addiction to unhealthy food and help halt spiraling rates of obesity, diabetes and heart disease.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: This might mean implementing policy such as a plastic tax that adds a cost to environmentally problematic action, or banning single-use plastics altogether.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: We need progressive policies that shape collective action and rein in polluting businesses, alongside engaged citizens pushing for change.

means.word_mean: 行动, 活动

sentences.en: The time has come for action.
sentences.cn: 行动的时候到了。

means.word_mean: 所做之事, 行为

sentences.en: He was sorry for his actions.
sentences.cn: 他为自己的行为感到懊悔。

means.word_mean: 事件的情节；(小说、故事、电影、戏剧或叙事诗等的)情节；剧情细节；情节发展

sentences.en: The action is set in France.
sentences.cn: 事情发生在法国。

means.word_mean: 作用, 功能

sentences.en: Photographs are produced by the action of light on film.
sentences.cn: 光对底片发生作用从而产生照片。

means.word_mean: 积极的活动，经常处于精力充沛的活动状态；活跃
[复数]举止，品行，(待人的)态度，日常表现
(某事产生的)作用，影响，反应，效应
动作；姿势，姿态
(机器、人体器官等的)运转，工作
[常作 the action][俚语]带投机性的工作；有趣事；快活行动；活力刺激
【法律】诉讼；诉讼权，提起诉讼之权  </seg>
战斗
行动;行为;活动
其他释义
行动;行为;作用

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)what someone actually does means more than what they say they will do
engaged in a certain activity; in operation

lj.lj_ly: watching him in action, normal workers are left in awe.
lj.lj_ls: 看他工作，普通工人都肃然起敬。

jx.jx_en_mean: a person whose life is characterized by physical activity or deeds rather than by words or intellectual matters
temporarily unable to engage in a certain activity; not working
jx.jx_cn_mean: 暂停活动，不（再）起作用；不（再）运转，失效

lj.lj_ly: a heart attack put him out of action.
lj.lj_ls: 他心脏病发作，无法继续工作。

entry.def: Action is doing something for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The government is taking emergency action to deal with a housing crisis...
example.tran: 政府正采取紧急措施解决住房危机。

example.ex: What was needed, he said, was decisive action to halt what he called these savage crimes.
example.tran: 他说，当务之急就是采取果断行动制止他所称的“这些野蛮罪行”。

entry.def: An action is something that you do on a particular occasion.

example.ex: As always, Peter had a reason for his action...
example.tran: 一如往常，彼得对自己的行为总有说辞。

example.ex: Jack was the sort of man who did not like his actions questioned.
example.tran: 杰克是那种不喜欢别人质疑自己行为的人。

entry.def: To bring a legal action against someone means to bring a case against them in a court of law.

example.ex: Two leading law firms are to prepare legal actions against tobacco companies.
example.tran: 两家很有名的律师事务所准备向烟草公司提起诉讼。

example.ex: ...a libel action brought by one of France's bureaucrats.
example.tran: 由法国的一名官员提起的诽谤诉讼

entry.def: The action of a chemical is the way in which it works, or the effects that it has.

example.ex: Her description of the nature and action of poisons is amazingly accurate.
example.tran: 他对一些毒药的性质和作用的描述惊人地准确。

entry.def: The action is all the important and exciting things that are happening in a situation.
entry.tran: 激动人心（或重要）的大事

example.ex: Hollywood is where the action is now.

entry.def: The fighting which takes place in a war can be referred to as action .

example.ex: Leaders in America have generally supported military action...
example.tran: 美国领导人普遍支持采取军事行动。

example.ex: 13 soldiers were killed and 10 wounded in action.
example.tran: 战斗中有13名士兵阵亡，10名士兵受伤。

entry.def: An action movie is a film in which a lot of dangerous and exciting things happen. An action hero is the main character in one of these films.
entry.tran: （电影）情节惊险刺激的；动作（片）的；动作片中的

example.ex: Stallone wants to break away from his action-hero image.
example.tran: 史泰龙想要摆脱动作明星的形象。

entry.def: If you action something that needs to be done, you deal with it.

example.ex: Documents can be actioned, or filed immediately.
example.tran: 文件可被立即处理或归档。

entry.def: If someone or something is out of action, they are injured or damaged and cannot work or be used.
entry.tran: （因受伤或损坏）不能工作，失去作用，无法运转

example.ex: He's been out of action for 16 months with a serious knee injury...
example.tran: 由于膝部严重受伤，他已停工16个月。

example.ex: They were trapped after the lifts went out of action.
example.tran: 电梯出现故障，他们被困在里面了。

entry.def: If someone wants to have a piece of the action or a slice of the action, they want to take part in an exciting activity or situation, usually in order to make money or become more important.
entry.tran: （通常为了赚钱或提高影响力）插手，参与

example.ex: Holiday spots have seen a dramatic revival and tourist chiefs are competing for a slice of the action.
example.tran: 各个度假点重又呈现出一派兴旺景象，旅游业的龙头老大们都在争着分一杯羹。

entry.def: If you put an idea or policy into action, you begin to use it or cause it to operate.

example.ex: They have learned the lessons of business management theory, and put them into action.
example.tran: 他们不仅学习了商业管理理论方面的课程，并且学以致用。

means.word_mean: 1. something done (usually as opposed to something said);

sentences.sentence: "there were stories of murders and other unnatural actions"

means.word_mean: 2. the state of being active;
3. a judicial proceeding brought by one party against another; one party prosecutes another for a wrong done or for protection of a right or for prevention of a wrong
4. an act by a government body or supranational organization;

sentences.sentence: "recent federal action undermined the segregationist position"
"the United Nations must have the power to propose and organize action without being hobbled by irrelevant issues"
"the Union action of emancipating Southern slaves"

means.word_mean: 5. a military engagement;
6. a process existing in or produced by nature (rather than by the intent of human beings);
7. the series of events that form a plot;

sentences.sentence: "his novels always have a lot of action"

means.word_mean: 8. the operating part that transmits power to a mechanism;

sentences.sentence: "the piano had a very stiff action"

means.word_mean: 9. the trait of being active and energetic and forceful;
10. the most important or interesting work or activity in a specific area or field;

sentences.sentence: "the action is no longer in technology stocks but in municipal bonds"
"gawkers always try to get as close to the action as possible"

means.word_mean: 1. institute legal proceedings against; file a suit against;

sentences.sentence: "He was warned that the district attorney would process him"

means.word_mean: 2. put in effect;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late middle English : via Old French from Latin actio(n-), from agere 'do, act'

sentences.cn: 我们每个人都必须对自己的行为负责。
